services package

accessories_service module

Accessories Service Module

This module provides business logic for accessory-related operations. It interacts with the AccessoryRepository to retrieve data from the database and transforms it into resource representations for API responses.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Retrieve all accessories with optional limits.

  • Retrieve a specific accessory by its ID.

src.services.accessories_service.get_all(database, accessory_limit=None)

Retrieves all accessories from the database, with an optional limit.

This function interacts with the AccessoryRepository to fetch accessory data and converts it into a list of AccessoryReturnResource objects.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • accessory_limit (int | None) – The maximum number of accessories to retrieve (optional).

Returns:

A list of accessories as AccessoryReturnResource.

Return type:

List[AccessoryReturnResource]

Raises:

TypeError – If accessory_limit is not of type int or None.

src.services.accessories_service.get_by_id(database, accessory_id)

Retrieves a specific accessory by its ID.

This function interacts with the AccessoryRepository to fetch a single accessory and converts it into an AccessoryReturnResource object.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • accessory_id (str) – The ID of the accessory to retrieve.

Returns:

The accessory as an AccessoryReturnResource.

Return type:

AccessoryReturnResource

Raises:

  • TypeError – If accessory_id is not of type str.

  • UnableToFindIdError – If no accessory is found with the given ID.

brands_service module

Brands Service Module

This module provides business logic for brand-related operations. It interacts with the BrandRepository to retrieve data from the database and transforms it into resource representations for API responses.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Retrieve all car brands with optional limits.

  • Retrieve a specific car brand by its ID.

src.services.brands_service.get_all(database, brands_limit=None)

Retrieves all car brands from the database, with an optional limit.

This function interacts with the BrandRepository to fetch brand data and converts it into a list of BrandReturnResource objects.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • brands_limit (int | None) – The maximum number of brands to retrieve (optional).

Returns:

A list of brands as BrandReturnResource.

Return type:

List[BrandReturnResource]

Raises:

TypeError – If brands_limit is not of type int or None.

src.services.brands_service.get_by_id(database, brand_id)

Retrieves a specific car brand by its ID.

This function interacts with the BrandRepository to fetch a single brand and converts it into a BrandReturnResource object.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • brand_id (str) – The ID of the brand to retrieve.

Returns:

The brand as a BrandReturnResource.

Return type:

BrandReturnResource

Raises:

  • TypeError – If brand_id is not of type str.

  • UnableToFindIdError – If no brand is found with the given ID.

  • Retrieve a specific color by its ID.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Retrieve all insurances with optional limits.

  • Retrieve a specific insurance by its ID.

Retrieves all insurances from the database, with an optional limit.

models_service module

Models Service Module

This module provides business logic for car model-related operations. It interacts with the ModelRepository and BrandRepository to retrieve data from the database and transforms it into resource representations for API responses.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Retrieve all car models with optional filters and limits.

  • Retrieve a specific car model by its ID.

src.services.models_service.get_all(database, brand_id=None, models_limit=None)

Retrieves all car models from the database, with optional filters and limits.

This function interacts with the ModelRepository to fetch car model data and converts it into a list of ModelReturnResource objects. If a brand_id is provided, the results are filtered to include only models associated with that brand. If a limit is provided, the number of results is restricted to the specified value.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • brand_id (str | None) – The ID of the brand to filter models by (optional).

  • models_limit (int | None) – The maximum number of models to retrieve (optional).

Returns:

A list of models as ModelReturnResource.

Return type:

List[ModelReturnResource]

Raises:

  • TypeError – If brand_id is not of type str or None, or if models_limit is not of type int or None.

  • UnableToFindIdError – If the specified brand ID does not exist.

src.services.models_service.get_by_id(database, model_id)

Retrieves a specific car model by its ID.

This function interacts with the ModelRepository to fetch a single car model and converts it into a ModelReturnResource object.

Parameters:

  • database (Database) – The database connection instance.

  • model_id (str) – The ID of the model to retrieve.

Returns:

The model as a ModelReturnResource.

Return type:

ModelReturnResource

Raises:

  • TypeError – If model_id is not of type str.

  • UnableToFindIdError – If no model is found with the given ID.
